meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 1/256 of a pound
meanings.sent1: She measured the spices in drachms for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler weighed the gold in drachms to determine its value.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally spilled drachms of sugar while baking cookies.
meanings.sent4: The importance of her words weighed more than a thousand drachms.
meanings.sent5: The drachms of sand slipping through the hourglass marked the passage of time.

meanings.definition: A small silver coin of ancient Greece
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient drachms from different periods.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, merchants used drachms for trade.
meanings.sent3: He found a drachm hidden in the sand during his archaeological dig.
meanings.sent4: The drachms in the treasure chest gleamed under the torchlight.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's eyes lit up when he received a drachm from a passerby.

meanings.sent1: She only needed a few drachms of paint to finish the artwork.
meanings.sent2: He added a drachm of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The drachms of rain were not enough to quench the thirsty plants.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was worth more than drachms of gold.
meanings.sent5: The drachms of laughter echoed through the room, bringing joy to all.
